page.title: 09Courteenhall East Lodge Farm
page.content: This a dairy and arable farm which supports a herd of 350 Pedigree British Friesians and a small herd of pigs. The farm is divided by the M1 motorway and is bounded by the parishes of Quinton and Roade and the route of the former SMJ Railway. The herd of older cattle consists of 130 milking cows plus 3 bulls and 70 heifers in calf. All calves are reared with the females being used as milking herd replacements and the males being fattened for slaughter at about eighteen months. There are currently 53 heifers not yet in calf but over one year old, plus 41 female and 27 males over six months old, and 14 males and 7 females under six months. The 465 acres of land is used for grazing and for growing cereals for feeding the livestock.
